title: Talk to HOME
summary: Home automation voice control for Philips HUE, SONOS, OpenHAB and HTTP / REST
description: Take control of your home with - Philips HUE- SONOS (R)- OpenHAB- REST/HTTPconnected devices with simple, customizable voice commands. Unlike Amazon Echo you don´t have to buy a new device but can use your existing ones.For HUE lights you can select pre-defined light scenes (as defined in the Philips HUE app), switch on/off all HUE bulbs alltogether or for specific groups/rooms. All OpenHAB devices and variables can be switched as defined in OpenHAB. Synchronisation of all configurations via Google Drive.Additional standard commands will tell you the current time and allow to set a timer or tell you the list of available commands.Talk2Home can be used through different ways:- in the App by pushing the voice button once- via "Ok, Google"- in the App by activation of Continuous Service (Wi-Fi only)- via Android Wear- via HTTP Call (REST)When using the Continuous Service on a device placed in a docking station at home, you can use the voice commands anytime without having to start the app.Starting the app itself via voice commands works also in connection with an Android Wear device.Available languages:- English- German- FrenchMinimum requirement is Android 4.2 (JellyBean)This app is not affiliated with Philips, Sonos Inc or Apple Inc.
descriptionHTML:
Take control of your home with
- Philips HUE
- SONOS (R)
- OpenHAB
- REST/HTTP
connected devices with simple, customizable voice commands.
Unlike Amazon Echo you don´t have to buy a new device but can use your existing ones.

For HUE lights you can select pre-defined light scenes (as defined in the Philips HUE app), switch on/off all HUE bulbs alltogether or for specific groups/rooms. All OpenHAB devices and variables can be switched as defined in OpenHAB. Synchronisation of all configurations via Google Drive.

Additional standard commands will tell you the current time and allow to set a timer or tell you the list of available commands.

Talk2Home can be used through different ways:
- in the App by pushing the voice button once
- via "Ok, Google"
- in the App by activation of Continuous Service (Wi-Fi only)
- via Android Wear
- via HTTP Call (REST)

When using the Continuous Service on a device placed in a docking station at home, you can use the voice commands anytime without having to start the app.
Starting the app itself via voice commands works also in connection with an Android Wear device.

Available languages:
- English
- German
- French

Minimum requirement is Android 4.2 (JellyBean)

This app is not affiliated with Philips, Sonos Inc or Apple Inc.
comments: I wish I could send MIDI or OSC  commands via WIFI to a virtual MIDI port on Windows.
Poorly tested app. Got into config and got stuck. No cancel accepted, no exit. Poor tested app. I ll do some more test....

Works great I use this for controlling my hue lights in my bed room/bath room and hallway. I use a  Bluetooth microphone thats linked to my tablet, I can be 20 to 30 feet away and still have perfect voice control

GREAT APPS Do great job....if the future update that work with bluetooth speaker where contintuosly listen the voice command through bluetooth headset speaker instead phone...apps has great potienal...please include this feature for next update...
Great Really great to have voice control for both Hue and Sonos. Loving it so far and look forward to more features. Well done.

the best works.well with my asus zenwatch2 and my sonos. much more practical to speak than type somethingon the watch. well done. also the package is worth when having other devices. I need to reconnect my hues ....
recentChanges: Choice between immediate prompt or wait for direct command after master keyword
Configurable speech prompts before and after command
Adapted to new HUE scene management, please activate scene sharing in HUE app
